channel.title: Electrum broken in Whonix 16
channel.description:
After installing the whonix 16 template and switching my appVM where I run electrum to whonix-ws-16 I've noticed Electrum isn't working anymore.
I've created a new AppVM based on whonix-ws-16 and then I can start Electrum fine, however when I copy the .electrum folder to the new appVM and open Electrum I get the following error:
Cannot load wallet (1): WalletFileException('This version of Electrum is too old to open this wallet.\n(highest supported storage version: 33, version of this file: 41)')
Was the version of Electrum downgraded in whonix 16?

item.title: Electrum broken in Whonix 16
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Whonix 16 has been Released! (Debian 11 bullseye based) - for VirtualBox - Major Release
  • package binaries-freedom is deprecated (reason ) (electrum installed from packages.debian.org stable repository)
  • Frozen Packages

Read full topic

Why was it downgraded if I may ask good sir?

item.title: Electrum broken in Whonix 16
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
buraka:

Was the version of Electrum downgraded in whonix 16?

Yes. Using Debian stable version.

To install newer:

Whonix – 4 Oct 21

How-to: Use Electrum Bitcoin Wallet in Whonix ™ - Manual Installation

How-to: Use Electrum Bitcoin Wallet in Whonix

Whonix – 26 Sep 21

Information Booster might be Available!

Utilizing other resources to help solve questions/issues unspecific to Whonix ™.

Read full topic

After installing the whonix 16 template and switching my appVM where I run electrum to whonix-ws-16 I’ve noticed Electrum isn’t working anymore.

I’ve created a new AppVM based on whonix-ws-16 and then I can start Electrum fine, however when I copy the .electrum folder to the new appVM and open Electrum I get the following error:

Cannot load wallet (1):

Was the version of Electrum downgraded in whonix 16?
